    Compute quantile of pwm for a given interval size

    gpwm_quantiles.Rd

    Computes the quantile of the pwm for a given interval size by sampling random intervals from the genome. The number of sequences to sample can be specified with n_sequences.

    Usage

    gpwm_quantiles(
  size,
  quantiles,
  pssm,
  spat = NULL,
  spat_min = 0,
  spat_max = NULL,
  bidirect = TRUE,
  prior = 0,
  n_sequences = 10000,
  dist_from_edge = 3000000,
  chromosomes = NULL
)

    Arguments

    size

    size of the intervals to sample

    quantiles

    quantiles to compute. See quantile for more details.

    pssm

    PSSM matrix or data frame

    spat

    a data frame with the spatial model (as returned from the $spat slot from the regression). Should contain a column called 'bin' and a column called 'spat_factor'.

    spat_min

    start of the spatial model from the beginning of the sequence (in bp)

    spat_max

    end of the spatial model from the beginning of the sequence (in bp). If NULL - the spatial model would end at the end of the sequence.

    bidirect

    is the motif bi-directional. If TRUE, the reverse-complement of the motif will be used as well.

    prior

    a prior probability for each nucleotide.

    n_sequences

    number of sequences to sample in order to compute the quantiles. The default is 1e4.

    dist_from_edge

    The minimum distance from the edge of the chromosome for a region to start or end(default: 3e6)

    chromosomes

    The chromosomes to sample from (default: all chromosomes)

    Value

    a named vector with the quantiles of the pwm for the given interval size.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
library(misha)
library(dplyr)
gdb.init_examples()
pssm <- JASPAR_motifs %>%
    filter(motif == "JASPAR.CDX1") %>%
    select(-motif)
gpwm_quantiles(1000, seq(0, 1, 0.1), pssm, dist_from_edge = 100)
}
